trans-unit.source: Animates the value of a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> property between two or more target values using a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> to specify those values.
This animation can be used to move a visual object along a path.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath> uses linear interpolation over a specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath> is similar to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimation> except that it uses a <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry> to interpolate over two or more values rather then between only two values like <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimation>.

Although <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimation> is used for most simple animations involving a Double value, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath> is particularly well suited for animating the position of an object on the screen.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath"></xref> class.
There is no default <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry> so the user must specify one.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Implementation of <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.CreateInstanceCore"></xref>.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable"></xref> created.
Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath"></xref>.

If the `defaultOriginValue` is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> that is not <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.Stopped%2A>.

The `defaultDestinationValue` is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.
The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.
The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that generates the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress"></xref> used by the animation.
The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current animation.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline>, and is shared by various derived classes.
`true` if the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the animation's value accumulates when it repeats.

When this property is set to `true`, the animation's output values only accumulate when the animation's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior%2A> property causes it to repeat its simple duration.
It does not accumulate its values when it restarts because its parent repeated or because its clock was restarted from a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ClockController.Begin%2A> call.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline>, and is shared by various derived classes.
`true` if the animation accumulates its values when its <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior"></xref> property causes it to repeat its simple duration.
otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Called when this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath"></xref> is modified.
Specifies the geometry used to generate this animation's output values.
In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], you can use a special abbreviated syntax to describe the path.

[!code-xml[PathAnimationGallery_snippet#DoubleAnimationUsingPathAttributeSyntaxExample](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PathAnimationGallery_snippet/CS/doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample.xaml#doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample)]

For more information about <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath.PathGeometry%2A> markup syntax, see [Path Markup Syntax](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/path-markup-syntax.md).
For more examples of creating a path using markup or code, see <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier Field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The path used to generate this animation's output values.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath.PathGeometry"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the aspect of this animation's <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath.PathGeometry"></xref> that determines its output value.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The aspect of this animation's <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath.PathGeometry"></xref> that determines its output value.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.PathAnimationSource.X"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath.Source"></xref> dependency property.
